comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Quite possibly Gregson-Ellis, G, Captain in the 1st Bn, Royal Berkshire Regiment whose 1st World War Campaign and Victory medals, ref to a mention in a diary, a 1917 3rd (Special Reserve) Bn cricket team photo including Gregson-Ellis, G S L and possible 1919 photo including him are seen here - The Wardrobe - Home of the Infantry Regiments of Berkshire and Wiltshire www.thewardrobe.org.uk/research/the-collection/search/dat... Photos show a likeness. Guy Saxon Llewellyn Gregson-Ellis Born:3rd November 1895, Kensington, London, England Died:12th August 1969, Banbury, Oxfordshire, England was a cricketer for Berkshire County Cricket Club. Main FCEuropeans (India) (1925/26-1926/27) Minor Counties ChampionshipBerkshire (1920-1923) Miscellaneous Charterhouse School (1913) His matches and detailed statistics are here: cricketarchive.com/Berkshire/Players/13/13568/statistics_...

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: George Saxon Llewellyn (Guy) GREGSON-ELLIS pedigree (Keith Winters winters-online.net/MerH/g1/p1291.htm) Lieutenant-Colonel in the Royal Berkshire Regiment . Married Jean between 1932 and 1953, the year of her death. Pedigree Sources: England & Wales FreeBMD (Ancestry.com) birth registration as Guy Saxon L. Gregson-Ellis England Census 1901 census as George S. L. G. Ellis. Charterhouse Register, 1872-1910, E M Jameson et al (Chiswick Press, 1911) vol.2, p. 827 “2 s of Charles James Gregson Ellis”. The Times, Thursday, Aug 14, 1969; pg. 16; Issue 57638; col A . Death announcement: Gregson-Ellis, Lt-Col Guy.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Capt. Reginald George (Rex) Gregson-Ellis is his elder brother. Attended Eton. Died at Peronne 17 April, 1917. Married with a dau Mary b 1911. www.roll-of-honour.com/Middlesex/LordsWW1.html Memorial High Wycombe Hospital www.buckinghamshireremembers.org.uk/php_scripts/bksidget.... + at All Saints High Wycombe with family crest. www.buckinghamshireremembers.org.uk/casualties/m4285.html Both brothers appeared in Wisden obituaries. Probably not a close relative of Philip George Saxon Gregson-Ellis. Guy Saxon L. Gregson-Ellis does not appear here thepeerage.com/i1296.htm#s18013 Major-General Philip George Saxon Gregson-Ellis CB OBE (1898–1956) was a British Army officer who commanded 5th Division. Commissioned into the Grenadier Guards 1917. Active throughout WWII. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philip_Gregson-Ellis

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
London Gazette, LG, entries for Princess Charlotte of Wales's Royal Berkshire Regiment

LG 29119 dated 6 Apr 1915   Temporary Lieutenant G S L Gregson-Ellis R. Berks to Lieutenant with effect 12 Mar 1915

LG 29176 dated 28 May 1915  Second Lieutenant G S L Gregson-Ellis R. Berks promoted from Second Lieutenant to [Temporary] Lieutenant ante-dated to 6 Jan 1915

LG 29771 dated 29 Sep 1916  Temporary Lieutenant G S L Gregson-Ellis R. Berks to [Temporary] Captain with effect 22 Jul 1916

LG 29804 dated 27 Oct 1916  Temporary Captain G S L Gregson-Ellis MC R. Berks to relinqish the rank of Captain with effect 27 Jul 1916

LG 30044 dated 1 May 1917  Lieutenant G S L Gregson-Ellis MC R. Berks to Captain with effect 12 Feb 1917//

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: Lieutenant G S L Gregson-Ellis R. Berks was awarded his Military Cross for bravery on 3rd June 1916 while serving with 1st Battalion Royal Berkshire Regiment. His medals, from the First and Second World Wars are held by The Wardrobe (Home Museum of the Infantry Regiments of Berkshire and Wiltshire) 58 The Close, Salisbury, Wiltshire, SP1 2EX. Viewable on-line at www.thewardrobe.org.uk/research/the-collection/search/cat...

comment.author: 68270186@N06
comment._content: Although it's almost 100 years ago...he still has amazing eyes ;-) ! Great photo!

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: Guy Saxon Llewellyn Gregson-Ellis married Jean (Gregson-Ellis or Hore) in the third quarter of 1933.  After her death in 1953 he married secondly Doris Sale in 1959.//
